data.title: negev: Latest News & Videos, Photos about negev
data.meta_description: negev Latest Breaking News, Pictures, Videos, and Special Reports from The Economic Times. negev  Blogs, Comments and Archive News on Economictimes.com
data.text:
Go To Page 1

Returning from Israel's nightmare: Indians' touching stories of return and operation Ajay

India launched Operation Ajay to facilitate the return of those who wish to come back home as a series of brazen attacks on Israeli towns by Hamas militants over the weekend triggered fresh tension in the region. Many students who returned home recalled the fateful night of Saturday and how they had to rush to shelters multiple times in the wake of rocket attacks by Hamas.

14 Oct, 2023, 12:06 PM IST

Tamil Nadu Agriculture University professor stranded in Israel, husband calls for help

An associate professor at the Tamil Nadu Agriculture University in India has been stranded in the conflict zone in Israel and is seeking help to return home. She has been staying in a desert region close to Gaza and has had to seek shelter during the bombardments. Her husband, who is also a professor at the same university, said that she is safe but stressed. The Indian embassy has been contacted and has assured to process her request to return. The Tamil Nadu government is also taking steps to ensure the safe return of all Tamils stranded in Israel.

14 Oct, 2023, 10:20 AM IST

Abandoned cars underline panic at Israeli music festival where Hamas gunmen killed hundreds

A massacre at an Israeli music festival by Hamas gunmen has resulted in the abandonment of hundreds of cars as people fled the scene. The attack, which killed 260 people and took captives back into Gaza, is the deadliest in Israel in decades. Drone footage shows destroyed cars with bullet impacts. Thousands attended the Nature Party, which was targeted by Palestinian gunmen who breached Gaza's border fence. At least 700 Israelis were killed and dozens abducted. The attack has left a profound shock on the country, known for its efficient military and security services.

10 Oct, 2023, 11:17 AM IST

Security Cabinet has approved "war situation", taking significant military steps: Israel PM's Office

The Israeli security cabinet has approved a "war situation" and significant military actions in response to a terrorist assault from the Gaza Strip. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated that the country is at war after Hamas launched a surprise attack, firing rockets into southern and central Israel. Israel Defense Forces spokesperson Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari called the attack a war crime and stated that those involved will pay the price.

08 Oct, 2023, 08:04 PM IST

Israel declares 'war' after 22 killed in massive rocket attack by Hamas militants

The Israel Defence Force (IDF) said it has launched operation 'Iron Swords' in response to Hamas's surprise attack - by air, land and sea - comprising a barrage of rockets from the Gaza Strip and infiltration into its heavily fortified border in the southern area that caught the country off-guard on a major holiday.

07 Oct, 2023, 05:43 PM IST

The comb dates to around 1700 BC, which is one of the oldest examples of the writing of Canaanites.

Luxurious 1,200-year-old mansion found in southern Israel

The luxury home is built around a courtyard and features four wings with several rooms for its residents. One lavish section features a marble hallway with stone floors and elaborate wall decorations. Archaeologists also found shards of decorated glass serving dishes.

23 Aug, 2022, 08:46 PM IST

75 Indian villages to be shaped with Israeli cooperation: Agriculture minister Narendra Singh Tomar

Tomar, who was in Israel on a four-day official visit from May 8, met his Israeli counterpart Oded Forer at the Knesset (Israel's Parliament). They discussed various issues related to modern agro techniques, capacity building, transfer of knowledge know-how and support in the fields of agriculture, water management, environment and rural development, keeping in view the scope and potential of agriculture development in both the countries.

Back-deep into snow, Jawans patrol forward areas to check infiltration in J-K's Poonch

"Snowfall or no snow---chilly winters or dangerous gorges--threat of attacks - our morale is high to keep round the clock vigilance along LoC. We are not scared of such situations and circumstances", a soldier guarding a forward post through his surveillance equipment tells the visiting journalists here.

Booster shot of Pfizer Covid vaccine can cut mortality from Delta variant by 90%: Study

A total of 843,208 participants met the eligibility criteria, of whom 758,118 (90 per cent) received the booster during the 54-day study period, according to the researchers, including those from Clalit Health Services and Ben-Gurion University of the Negev, Israel.

Cricket club comes to rescue of Indian researchers in southern Israeli city under attack from Hamas

The Beersheba Cricket Club building, a two-storey structure close to the University, which is actually a shelter house with an underground floor, opened its door for the local residents immediately after rockets launched by Palestinian militants started to fall on Israel's southern areas and also extended the kind gesture to Indian researchers at the University.

17 May, 2021, 02:50 PM IST

Adani Defence to focus on small arms and ammo, anti-drone systems

A range of small arms--from assault rifles of the Tavor family to light machine guns (LMGs) and assault carbines--were on display by the company at the AeroIndia show, the first since it acquired 51% stake in PLR Systems, a joint venture company with Israel Weapons Industry (IW).
